item.title: Broken branch on tree outside 11 Pellerin Road, 2nd July
item.description:
At some point in the night, one of the branches on the tree outside 11 Pellerin Road has broken. It is now halfway down and blocking part of the footpath.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hayling Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Constant Rubbish, 2nd July
item.description:
Local businesses need to take responsibility for their bins and dispose of rubbish and recycling. The area is in a constant mess as a result which is unpleasant for everyone.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sandringham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flower beds on Proctor Street, west of Red Lion Square, 2nd July
item.description:
When the bicycle lanes were installed, so were flower beds, but in spite of promises in the promotional pictures, nothing has been planted and only weeds are growing. When will the flower beds have flowering plants similar to what, for example, Bedford Row has?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drake Street, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant rubbish scattered over this section of the road, 2nd July
item.description:
Tenants are heavily polluting our roads by piling rubbish as on their property driveways also on the public footpaths. Footpaths are constantly cluttered by theirs overflowing bins and scattered all over the area. School kids are walking up and down to school over these piles of rubbish on daily basis. This is unacceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More rubbish dumping and overflowing bins., 2nd July

item.title: Urgent street clean, 2nd July
item.description:
This was originally reported on 18th June and now says case closed. please advise when this road will be swept as there are so many stones and muck in the road. The roadsweeper has been along this road this morning and the machine has left more waste in the road than collected (alot of stones etc) please get him to return
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hansol Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
